Reviews.Content: loved the melao planning to go back this october my husband took me to punta cana for my birthday in october, 2003. we stayed at the riu melao it was a wonderful experience. the rooms were clean, the beach was just beautiful, i enjoyed the the shows, shopping, the outside huts for drinks and food. i fell in love there i wanted to quit my job and stay. so this october we are planning to come back for my birthday and we are planning to bring more people with us this time last time it was just my husband and myself but i want the family to experience what we did.
Reviews.Author: scrubtech86

Reviews.Content: Great People, Awesome vacation!! We just returned from our Honeymoon at the RIU Melao in Punta Cana. We purchased a RIU Riulette from our travel agent as we had never been anywhere south before and were open to anything so it was a good deal for us. We ended up getting RIU Taino at the airport but as Taino and Melao are now run out of the same desk our room was on Melao. I think we ended up in the best resort as far as we were concerned. The staff at our resort were exceptional! Right away when they found out we were Honeymooners - we were upgraded to a bigger room -King bed - lots of towel animals and balloons. The first member of the staff we met was Genndy. He is the main bartender/ steward. He sent us champagne to our room and was always ready to have a laugh and grab us our drinks etc. He spoke English fairly well, so that was helpful as he could translate the Spanish for us. Our waiter we had everyday was Jos茅. Although his English was limited - he tried always to be so friendly and outgoing. Great person!!The manager Roberto was awesome -he arranged for two special dinners for us at the Palace Macao - one for my husbands birthday! Not to mention countless other little things. The beaches have soft, white sand, the water is the beautiful, clear Caribbean water and our resort was awesome.We went on a great excursion called Bavarro Runners - so great to see the actual country and how people live - awesome!! Would recommend highly!! Jacky was the guide -so fun. Can't say enough good things about this place. I work in the Hotel industry and can be very picky about accommodations - so if I loved - I am sure it you will too!!! This is great spot for a quiet time - not really a party place. The best vacation I have ever had!!!
Reviews.Author: OctoberBride13

Reviews.Content: Super le melao               More photos
Reviews.Author: Alexandre_06

Reviews.Content: Average resort               More photos
Reviews.Author: ocean79

Reviews.Content: unable to sleep The Dominican Republic has an amazing and diverse cultural heritage. It is independently thriving with its agricultural and industiral developments. I am unable to convince myself to return however, mostly due to my stay at this hotel in 2003. My son, who was 3 at the time, tripped over a very large rat one evening by the pool after participating in a children's program. The rat was large-probably around 5-8 pounds. Luckily my husband scooped him up as the rat was circling around with a broken leg and he avoided being bitten. There were rats playing around the pool area during the day causing guests to scream occasionally and raise their feet up to their chairs. There were large cockroaches in our room on the ground floor. The pillows smelled of mildew. After the rat episode on the third evening we requested to be moved to a new room on an upper floor. In the second room we did not see any cockroaches-this may have been due to sleeping with all the lights on due to my fear of the rats. The pillows in this room also smelled like mildew. In one restaurant for an evening meal my husband had to use the restroom. There were roaches crawling out of cracks in the walls. The food tasted great and we did not get sick. I just can't help but imagine the roaches and rats walking over the kitchen areas since they were out in public areas. I could not sleep and anticipated the end of our trip. We decided to get a Taxi and go into a small town to shop. A prostitute approached my husband while in a cafe with myself and our 3 year old. A man from a shop attempted to carry off my child in an attempt to get us to follow him to his store (this was not encouraging to get us to buy something). Finally we were riding the shuttle back to the airport and are pulled over by men with machine guns. Apparently we were attempting to return to the airport when government members were arriving for the latin american summit. We have stayed at other Riu properties in Latin America, and the Melao was an entirely different experience. I do realize that the climate is very nice for roaches and rats, but the hotel needs desperately to implement some form of pest control as well as dehumidification system in the rooms. I did not feel safe (especially for my child) for these health reasons as well as the political instability. My husband is a police officer and speaks Spanish fluently and usually we are comfortable traveling about and had looked forward to a trip to the Dominican Republic for quite some time. It is the most unforgetable trip we have ever been on.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very nice vacation This hotel was extremely nice. The beach is absolutely amazing. The excursions offered in this area are fun and reasonably priced. We took a sunset horseback ride right along the beach! It was very romantic and cool! The food was good, the service was excellent and the facility was clean. There is a good mix of Europeans on the property, so don't expect too many people to speak english to you! For a romantic getaway, this is a nice place to stay. This property lives up to the Riu's standard of excellence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: coming back we have been to many places in the carribean and so far the riu hotels were the best. at the riu melao the manager and co-manager greeted us every evening. the food was wonderful and the service was always with a smile. we are going again next month.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Absolutely outstanding! Incredible Service!!! I stayed at the Riu Melao November 2002 with myhusband and 5 month old son. I have holidayed in the Caribbean 5 times now Dom Rep 4 and Jamaica 1. What an absolutely outstanding hotel. It is not huge but beautiful and the level of service is that of I have never seen before. The staff were falling over themselves for you and they couldn't do enough for you. The two male managers were outstanding and everso friendly - personally introducing themselves to you at the dining table on the first or second evening there. The beach is lovely, scattered with palm trees so it easy to get some shade when needed. This hotel is the smallest and quietest of the 5 Riu hoels on the Punta Cana complex. If you want more evening entertainment then visit the Riu Bambo. You are able to use all other hotels but not the Palace.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous Went there in 2001, the staff, management and service people couldn't have been nicer( except for the dive scheduler) and even then they tried to make up for it by giving us free horsback riding. I forgot long pants for dinner and had to go buy some, that didn't fit. The manager offered and took them home to hem and take them in all for free.. Wonderful folks!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Melao - Muy Bien Spent a week in March 2003 in RIU Melao. Everything was better than I expected. The hotel area is beautiful surrounded by gardens. The rooms were clean. The staff was extremely friendly and active. Riu Melao has many activities (Merengue lessons, water gym, ...) thoughout the day.F ood was excellent. The dinner buffet menu changes daily. Food and beverages are available all the time. Most of the guests were more than 30 years old (couples) or children. Guests were mainly from France, Germany, Italy, Spain, USA and Canada. I suppose Riu Melao is not an ultimate partying resort for those who want to party heavily. During the nights (11 pm - ...) there was not disturbance from the surrounding environment at all.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Summer Specials - Fun, sun and Diving August 2002: Booked a last minute 7-day package deal - and what a deal it was! Clean rooms, great service, good food. Rooms are stocked with a free mini-bar and fridge with soft drinks and beer.Beaches were very nice. Strong breezes kept the heat down. There are palm trees that ring the beach line, letting you sit in the sun or under the shade trees - your choice. A barrier reef forms a break water, creating a pool effect in many parts of the beach. Decent snorkeling opportunity. Boat operators were very conscientious about respecting swimming zones, too. The on-site dive operator uses outboard motor driven open boats that they run right up on the beach to pick you up. Diving was good for beginner - ok for medium skill level, but not challenging (except climbing back into the boat - no platforms). Surf can be fairly heavy here, except in August (seas were 3 ft or less while we there)! Clientele is heavily European (i.e., fair number of topless women - but the hotels STRONGLY discourage full nudity, especially at the pools!) English was widely spoken, but probably 3rd or 4th on the list (Spanish, Dutch, German, Engilish).There is shopping at the RIU complex, an open market about a mile down the beach (nice walk), and in town (about 10 minute taxi ride).This was a good place to unwind - no problem recommending it!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Rui Meloa My husband and I just returned from spending 15 days at the Riu Melao in Punta Cana. This was our third consecutive year in Punta Cana, but the first time at the Riu Melao (last year we stayed at the Riu Bambu). The Melao is the smallest of the 5 Riu Hotels in the complex there. It is also the oldest. The swimming pool is small, but okay. The rooms are small, but also okay with twin beds pushed together. If you like to use a washcloth, take your own. They don't supply them. Also the sheets are not fitted so they have a tendency to rumple up around you during the night while you sleep - especially if you are a large person. I brought special sheet garters that I attached to the sheets and slipped around the corners of the mattress- they worked quite well. The food can be repetitious, but it is good. The Melao is very close to the beach so that is nice. The trees and plants around the Melao are quite spectacular. You feel like you're in the jungle. The director, Gustavo and sub-director, Ernesto are very, very nice as well as accomodating. If you have a problem and tell them, they see that it is taken care of immedately. We needed extra pillows, our bathroom lights burned out, and the lock on our sliding glass doorwall out to our terrace needed to be repaired. All of this was done within a few hours after we reported our needs. The staff is extremely friendly even though we often times had a hard time understanding each other. Most staff speak Spanish with a smattering of English thrown in. We'll return to the Riu Hotel complex next year, but probably stay at the Riu Bambu or Riu Taino. These hotels are newer, have bigger pools with swimup bars, have better and more of a variety of food, and have better nighttime entertainment and daytime activities.....they are much more glamorous than the Melao. We did enjoy the Melao though.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautiful! My husband and I visited Punta Cana for the first time the beginning of February and thought it was one of the most beautiful places we have ever been. The beaches have soft, white sand, the water is the beautiful, clear Caribbean water and our resort was awesome. We stayed at the Riu Melao and were pleasantly surprised. The grounds were immaculate, service was speedy and friendly, drinks were yummy (and strong) and the food was better than expected. Our only complaint, and this is coming from spoiled Americans, is that the air conditioning in the rooms was less than adequate. I know we went south for warmth, but there was never any relief from the heat. The restaurants are not air conditioned, so you are always hot and sticky. Maybe the 5 star Riu Resorts had better HVAC. We loved that we could use all 5 of the Riu Resorts. We did eat at the ala carte restaurants twice and thought they were pretty good. My husband did get sick towards the end of our trip probably due to the water. Do NOT even brush you teeth with the tap water. This is definitely a true beach vacation, so if you want lots of activity, this might not be for you. But it's beautiful!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A cultural experience We've vacationed in Punta Cana for the last four years. The last two were at Rui Melao. We just returned from atwo week stay. About 80 % of the people were from France this time. The rest was a mixture of German, Swiss, Italian, Canadian and Americans. We met wonderful people...the only rude people we ran into (I'm ashamed to say) were fellow Americans.We find the food, staff and accomodations nothing but wonderful.The Rui gave a discount for the second week which many of the other resorts do not.Can't wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Riu beware american tourists stayed in riu spring of 2002 wife broke her leg and resort manager was to busy flirting with women to be bothered. then I was charged to use a wheel-chair the remainder of our stay. now 10 months later wife has to have more surgery and riu will not even acknowledge my mail or calls not even an apology when it was their fault my wifes leg was broke because of lazy cleaning staff. oh food all tastes the same after 2 days and as I stated before unless your a single woman forget getting any type of assistance from management they are to busy tryin to score with the girls
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful My husband and I found ourself on a plane last January 2002 to Punta Cana. We had planned a trip to Las Vegas but couldn't get a good deal. So here we were we had a good deal but knew nothing about where we where going, but we figured for what we paid it wouldn't be much1 We would have beach, a room, and food! Boy were we suprised. This place was wonderful. We have been on 20 cruises and have traveled around the world to different places but this was great and cheap! We went back in Feburary, our Daughter and her husband went in March, and We went again in April with two of my sisters and their husbands. If you find yourself with a long weekend it is a great place to go. I can't what to go again.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Spring 2001 and returning in 2002 My husband and I stayed at the Riu Melao in Spring of 2001 and are returning in the Spring of 2002 because we enjoyed it so much. The Melao is the smallest of the 4 Riu resorts in Punta Cana. The rooms were clean and adequate, the staffoutstanding, the food excellent. Guests were able to eat at the snack bars of the other Rius (except the Palace). The Carribean Street offers a festival night once a week featuring dancers, skits, animals etc. Very nicely done. There is also a cyber place where you can send and receive email ($5 per 30 mins). The resort tends to attract a lot of Europeans, especially Germans whom I found to be just downright rude to other guests. Most would not acknowledge a simple good day greeting. But that has nothing to do with the resort. Just letting folks know! It is not stopping us from going back. Please contact me if you would like more information!kbulger@michweb.net
Reviews.Author: lass=
